title: Machine Learning-Based Framework Development for Alloy Design in Additive Manufacturing

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations in materials science, thermodynamics understanding, programming and data analysis experience, linear algebra and probability theory knowledge
context.additional_context: Students work in teams to solve alloy design problems using real additive manufacturing process data, employing cloud-based ML tools (Jupyter Notebook, etc.) in BYOD environments

learning_goals: The thermodynamic properties and material limitations of additive manufacturing processes can be explained
Over three core AM characteristics, such as solidification range/growth restriction coefficient of alloys, can be predicted using machine learning models
Projects implementing multi-objective optimization problems can be completed using Python-based ML frameworks (TensorFlow/PyTorch)
Reports comparing predicted microstructural properties of designed alloys with simulation data and experimental results can be written

resources: Additive Manufacturing Process Dataset (Based on Public Repository)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
